intro: Tanacetum schugnanicum, commonly known as the Schugnan tansy, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, silvery-green leaves with a strong, camphor-like scent. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in flat-topped clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
